intro: Clinogyne canniformis, commonly known as the broadleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Clinogyne canniformis prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
